keywords.indexterm: matrix last row cell column item properties

strow.stentry: This read-only property differentiates a computed column from a column created by an attribute drop.

section.title: Description
section.p: A description of the item can be provided in this section.

strow.stentry:
CSS class type is a list of the following possibilities:
Corporate (default value; this means that the default cell style is not changed).
Specific (the user gives the name of a specific class).
Conditional.
When Css class type is set to Specific, this property defines the specific class to be used.

When Css class type is set to Conditional, this property defines the specific class to be used if the user defined condition is true. The user-defined condition and the specific class are defined by clicking the button located on the right of the property and by populating the following fields:
Name: the name of the condition.
Java code: Boolean expression.
Result: the CSS class to be used if the Boolean expression returns true.

section.title: Translation
section.p: A translation can be defined for the tooltip only (label displayed when the mouse is over the cell).
